meanings.definition: Having a protruding or sulky lip.
meanings.sent1: She looked poutier than usual after losing the game.
meanings.sent2: The child's poutier expression showed his disappointment.
meanings.sent3: Even the grumpy cat seemed poutier than the grumpy dog.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered in a poutier manner, ready to burst.
meanings.sent5: Her poutier face made it clear she was upset.

meanings.sent1: The little girl was known as the poutier of the group.
meanings.sent2: He was labeled as the office poutier due to his constant sulking.
meanings.sent3: The poutier always brightened up when offered a treat.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as the poutier in the mirror, practicing different pouts.
meanings.sent5: The poutier's presence always brought a gloomy atmosphere.
